intro: Lasiochlamys grossecrenata, commonly known as the rough-leaved lasiochlamys, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves, which are often covered in fine, rough hairs. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
